ygData.subject: Re: One more thing.
ygData.msgSnippet: hmmm... i dunno lah... i guess good thing bout High Elf is high overall stats... but low STA, DEX and AGI... high CHA, high WIS... for dark elves... LOW CHA,
ygData.messageBody:
hmmm... i dunno lah... i guess good thing bout High Elf is high overall
stats... but low STA, DEX and AGI... high CHA, high WIS...
for dark elves... LOW CHA, LOW STR... the rest are average to good...

maybe im the type that will restart if i think its not good enough for
the1st try.... n perhaps thast 1 reason for the born of the new wizard...
bcos stats wise for the DE Wiz... hes good... and so far been good... have
the following stats...
STR60
STA80
DEX75
AGI80/or 90
INT134
CHA60

dunno what stats HE got... another reason for this DE is bcos i know the
place upside down... so starting is easy... i dont have to learn each n
every shop... every person from scratch again... thast y its possible for
the fast leveling... (maybe not when compared to sereph de ahgua lah)...

cheers,
Freed/ Nic
----- Original Message -----
From: LKW <leekw13@...>
To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, August 30, 1999 5:11 PM
Subject: RE: [sg-everquest] One more thing.


> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>
> Err, why do u think I'm a High-Elf then? Hehe.
>
> Out off all races, I still prefer HE, just personal preference.
>
> Frankly speaking, I think other than the begining stats, ya playing style
> and artifacts also affect ya 'power'. Of coz in perfect situation, given
> same artifacts and same playing style, Erudite is still the most powerful
> wiz. On the other hand, my low INT wiz is still surviving well so far
(134
> now with my gears). Afterall, been higher in INT mean lower in other
> stats, which can be good and bad in different situations. I do regret not
> pumping max INT to my Ziltus thou, but with the artifact he is holding
now,
> he can still handle things well.
>
> Let put in this way, personal perference really matter here. I guess I
> wont wanna be a DE in Inno even if they got higher INT than erudite,
simply
> becoz I dun like to be evil and KOS by other races. Same thoery as I
> cannot make myself a PKer in UO, thou I got the capabilty and the money to
> do so, heheh.
>
> Talk abt WIS, I'm not sure the low rate for spell fizzy is due to my high
> WIS or evoke spec. For me, fizzy happens less than 3% of my casting, I
> mean at lvl 30 with 98 WIS. Pls feedback.
>
>
> Ziltus
>
>
> On Monday, 30 August, 1999 3:22 PM, Sereph [SMTP:garford@...]
> wrote:
> > From: Sereph <garford@...>
> >
> > Actually, High Elf wiz is good, because of their high wisdom. Since
> spells eat
> > more and more mana and cycle slowly as you gain in level, a fizzle can
> make you
> > vomit blood.
> >
> > LKW wrote:
> >
> > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > >
> > > Oh oh, u must also know this.... ;)
> > >
> > > FYI, at high lvl, we wiz use mid-lvl spells for "melee" - like Les and
> me,
> > > one hand hold Black Book with Silver Rune, the other holding Glowing
> Stein,
> > > where got time for STA, DEX and AGI? Hehe. U can also buy a coldstone
> from
> > > magi and put it in ya ammo slot - got ultravision liao. PLUS, the
fact
> > > that u can bank tat coldstone using the bag trick and hold it
> > > forever...simi is ultravision huh? Easy lah, hehe.
> > >
> > > So in the end, Erudite wiz still the most powerful nuker. And due to
> the
> > > coldstone thing, gnome wiz is still better than DE wiz, they got even
> > > higher DEX and AGI, plus they can do tinkering...no forgetting gnome
> and
> > > dwarf r the only true neutral races in EQ which wont get KOS from any
> race
> > > from the start and can use bank/shop services in all good races
cities.
> ;)
> > >
> > > Ziltus
> > >
> > > On Monday, 30 August, 1999 12:01 PM, Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy
> > > [SMTP:sccheng@...] wrote:
> > > > hehe.. one more thing...
> > > > ziltus u must hear this.. Dark Elf with max INT into it is 134 and
80
> on
> > > STA... they also have high DEX and AGI... so i think they are better
> than
> > > gnome n erudite since they also have utravision.
> > > >
> > > > thast all for now.. hehe...
> > > > Nic or Freed
